comment.author: 18753752@N00
comment._content: First woman elected to a state office in Oklahoma. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kate_Barnard

comment.author: 11876841@N07
comment._content: She was extensively active with charitable endeavors, and worked toward the betterment of the people around her.

comment.author: 27398485@N08
comment._content: See also: www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr& GRid=9564189 - Kate Barnard was a social reformer and politician - led legislation for Mental Health and Human Services - elected Commissioner of Charities and Corrections in 1907 before women could vote - founded first prison penitentiary system in Oklahoma for rehabilitation purposes

comment.author: 87914514@N00
comment._content: This photo is being discussed in one of the projects in the Flickr Commons group, and we would love to have this added to the group pool!

comment.author: 54017078@N00
comment._content: What a beautiful portrait. i love her expression.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Photographed by Bain News Service on December 2, 1912, when she was in New York to deliver lectures, and to become acquainted with the metropolis. New York Times, December 8, 1912: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F00E6DB1E3AE633A... Date sticker is easier to read on this companion photo. (View large): www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2459824668/in/p...
